author: Special Correspondent
text:
A high-level meeting presided over by the Trinamool Congress Chairperson Mamata Banerjee has “nearly” finalised the list of candidates on Wednesday in a meeting attended by the top leadership of the party.

A report, earlier commissioned by Ms. Banerjee, was also submitted to her by party’s senior management during the day-long meeting. The report concluded, among other things, that out of 11 seats in Kolkata, six “are risky” and candidates in one or two of those seats could be shuffled, changed, sources told The Hindu .

The impact of internal squabbles during and after distribution of tickets were also discussed and Ms. Banerjee has asked the leadership to update her about the issues in detail. “Earlier in party’s general council meeting she had told us to firmly deal with internal feuds. She reminded us about the importance to remain united before the election,” one of the leaders told The Hindu .

Senior leaders including Mukul Roy, Partha Chatterjee, Firhad Hakim and Arup Biswas attended the meeting.

A high level meeting finalised the list of candidates of TMC on Wednesday
title: Six seats are ‘risky’ for Trinamool, says report
